definition[0]: to support a wall or roof with large pieces of wood, metal etc to stop it from falling down
example[0]: The roof had been shored up with old timbers.
definition[1]: to help or support something that is likely to fail or is not working well
example[1]: attempts to shore up the struggling economy
definition[2]: to help a system or organization that is likely to fail or is not working well
example[2]: The company was shored up by an emergency infusion of cash from its main bank.
